title: Drawing, "Design after Three Paintings after Giulio Romano; Verso, Lion and Four Views of Head if an Eagle", 1812–14
medium: Pen and brown ink, brush and sepia wash over traces of graphite on cream laid paper
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors
description: Sketchbook page: folio 95. Two girls riding on bull. They flee to shore. Assault of town. Inscription for each: Giulio Romano Mantua.  Left bottom corner: 95, top left 159.  On Verso: lion licks his left fore leg.  Three profiles, one front.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Design after Three Paintings after Giulio Romano; Verso, Lion and Four Views of Head if an Eagle", 1812–14.
1812–14. Pen and brown ink, brush and sepia wash over traces of graphite on cream laid paper. Museum purchase through gift of various donors. 1901-39-1346.
